actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Assistance and Unemployment Compensation.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Assistance and Unemployment Compensation

official_title: A bill to provide that the 20-week work requirement established by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 for purposes of eligibility to receive extended unemployment compensation shall not apply with respect to benefit years established before January 1, 1983.

summary.text: Provides that, with respect to weeks of unemployment beginning after the date of enactment of this Act and benefit years beginning before January 1, 1983, the 20-week work requirement established by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 shall not apply for purposes of determining eligibility to receive extended unemployment compensation and Federal supplemental compensation.

titles.title: A bill to provide that the 20-week work requirement established by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 for purposes of eligibility to receive extended unemployment compensation shall not apply with respect to benefit years established before January 1, 1983.
